headline: Tech Founder | Engineering Leader | Built and Sold Startups | Scaling Engineering Teams from 0‚Üí100
about:
Accomplished Engineering Leader with track record of taking R&D site from scratch to and through successful acquisition.

Jan is Maths and Physics graduate turned into Software Engineer with various technologies and platforms, skilled Software Architect and Analyst, turned into Director of Engineering. Jan enjoys not only solving problems, but also getting to the very bottom of them, deeply understanding the processes as well as the motivations behind.

Jan started programming at the age of 9, developing system utilities in 8086 Assembler. Later, he was consumed by digital art and demoscene.  The love for visualization led to creation of Rthree, a powerful scientific visualization tool, used world-wide in mostly academic circles.

In his post-university career, Jan developed high volume cloud-deployed engagement apps (stand-alone widgets and Facebook apps) for Webtrends as a full-stack software engineer, was leading the development of a large-scale oriented CMS platform and founded DocFillet, a Virtual Data Room solution.

In 2014, Jan co-founded ambitious enterprise-oriented start-up Sapho as a Lead Front-End Engineer. He founded Sapho's R&D office in Prague, Czech Republic, and took it from 1 to 70 people, overseeing Research and Development. His mission was to help to bring a whole new approach into employees' data consumption and mundane tasks automatization. Sapho was acquired by Citrix Systems in November 2018 for more than $200M. Jan oversaw the integration of start-up team into the corporate structures and also integration of the Sapho technology into Citrix Workspace Intelligence.

Jan has co-authored several patented technologies around consolidated identity, detecting changes in large data-sets and related technologies.

experiences.title: Senior Vice President of Engineering
experiences.jobDescription:
My responsibilities included:

- Building up the multi-layered Engineering department
- Definition of robust hiring strategy and hiring pipeline creation
- Introduction of Platform + Security team, promoting a switch to Infrastructure as a Code
- Introduction of Quality Control team, methodologies and processes
- Introduction of lightweight Agile methodology, work estimations and exact and accurate capacity planning
- Driving a change from Full-Stack developers into specialised Back-End and Front-End engineers
- Driving a change from top-down architecture to co-owned architecture
- Building up Research / Optimization team and leading it
- Defining and driving Technical Debt tackling; Eradicating Out-of-life technologies
- Operating 7-figures USD annual budget
- Setting up and maintaining a strong engineering-centric startup culture across multiple continents
- Driving company-wide changes towards Security standards and Software-building mindset
- Close cooperation with Product department and other peers and other stakeholders
- Participation on Company-wide OKRs, Product Roadmap, Go-To-Market fit
- Advocating for Software Engineering best practices throughout all company departments and functions
- Driving partnerships / cooperation with Universities and other companies

publications.title: Level-set method and its selected applications in incompressible fluid mechanics (Master Thesis)
publications.summary: Abstract: This thesis focuses on two-dimensional computational simulations of flows of two immiscible incompressible viscous fluids with surface tension, while fixed computation grid is used. Free interface between fluids is realized by the level-set method that is suitable to capture changes in the interface topology. The flow is described by the Navier-Stokes equations for incompressible fluids, numerical discretization is done by finite elements method with Q2 - P1 elements, while whole problem is solved as coupled. Several example simulations are presented, an overview of numerical examples and analysis results related to this topic is also provided.

patents.title: Detecting and reporting changes in data values
patents.subtitle: US20200349144A1 504585914 ¬∑ Issued Jun 14, 2022
patents.description: A monitoring module interfaces with existing non-retrospective data storage systems, thus providing mechanisms for detecting and reporting changes in data values stored in such systems. The monitoring module acts as a change detection layer that can operate in connection with multiple disparate systems and/or locations, so as to provide users with a unified view into data stored in such systems. For example, a user can consult a single app, website, or software application, to view changes for data values stored in multiple disparate systems and/or locations; the app can be configured to automatically generate notifications and alerts to users, and can provide the ability to respond to such notifications and alerts, take actions, and/or dive deeper into underlying data.

patents.title: Consolidated identity
patents.subtitle: US20190199729A1 ¬∑ Issued Apr 26, 2022
patents.description: According to various embodiments, a consolidated identity system and method are implemented to provide improved identity management and resource access management, particularly in the context of an enterprise system that requires a tight trust model. In at least one embodiment, the described system and method provide mechanisms for mapping identities among resources. The system and method are able to extract information relevant to a particular entity, such as an employee or user, and to consolidate and/or personalize such information as needed.

recommendations.description:
I had the priviledge to work with Jozef for more than 3 years in a start-up environment.

Jozef has proven to be a detail oriented, well motivated, technically sound product manager with overlaps into UI, UX and also Business Analytics. He always wanted to truly understand the task at hand and went many extra miles to produce great work. Jozef was also keen to drive efforts whenever he was asked to, or wherever he'd seen fit, which helped to shape the product tremendously.

I would hire Jozef again without hesitation.

recommendations.subtitle: Rewriting the rules of ads with GenAI

I had the priviledge to directly watch Marek's professional career for over 4 years in a start-up environment. During this time, Marek was able to maintain brilliant quality and first-class effectiveness of his work as an all-rounded senior engineer, has proven to be a truly valuable team member, and eventually even stepped up to take the responsibility for the team. Marek then continued to grow as a technically keen manager and has not only returned all the faith we've put in him, but many times more. He is on a path to become a great leader.

I would re-hire Marek into many roles and/or invite him into a cooperation in a split second.

headline: CTO @ Bright Cape ‚ú®ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è AI Expert ü¶æ Keynote Speaker
about: Technology, automation, and optimization have been key interests throughout my life. With a Master's in Computer Science and a Specialization in Machine Learning, I acquired all the technical know-how to deploy these interests in the real world. This deployment does not limit itself to my technical skills in AI and software architecture, this is also a main strategy in my professional skills in management, strategy, and sales. Throughout my career including studies a combination of these technical and professional skills is what allowed me to offer unique value to organizations I‚Äôve been a part of and I strive to keep on being this essential bridge between the highly technical and business interests.

experiences.title: Chief Technology Officer
experiences.jobDescription: As CTO I‚Äôm tasked with determining the tech strategy, identifying opportunities at new and exciting clients and helping out my colleagues with technical challenges.

experiences.title: CTO and Founder
experiences.jobDescription:
FruitPunch AI aims to devlop, educate and incubate AI for Good. This by globalizing the FruitPunch AI community, providing AI challenge-based education and organizing real-world AI challenges together with our partners to be tackled by our community. 

My role at FruitPunch was as CTO and Founder but since these come in many flavors I‚Äôll give some insight into my responsibilities. 

Technical
‚Ä¢ Checking feasibility and create road maps for AI projects
‚Ä¢ Creating AI Education strategy
‚Ä¢ Developing, designing, and giving AI Education
‚Ä¢ Giving technical advice to AI development teams
‚Ä¢ Doing data analysis and developing AI applications
‚Ä¢ Leading our platform development team
‚Ä¢ Determining platform roadmap and user stories
‚Ä¢ Setting up data an software architecture
‚Ä¢ Speaking on AI projects to developer audiances

Managerial
‚Ä¢ Managing large teams of engineers
‚Ä¢ Speaking at events and to non-technical stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Running the daily operation of projects and education
‚Ä¢ Business Development and sales
‚Ä¢ Product and company strategy
‚Ä¢ Product ownership and project management
‚Ä¢ Administration, legal, finance, HR (automating it)
‚Ä¢ Team events, office, and borrels!

recommendations.name: Joyce Roco
recommendations.subtitle: Product Design Leader | User-Centered Design | FinTech | Digital Innovator | Public Speaker
recommendations.description:
Joyce is a blast to work with on both the personal and professional level. As a product lead, she is very self-sufficient, determining what has priority and executing on it. She will quickly pick up feedback and come up with resolutions. She has a sharp eye for design and is both able to decide its direction and not afraid to create a fully clickable mockup when necessary. She speaks the language of developers and is therefore very effective in communicating her ideas to them and quickly resolving any issues in a pragmatic way.
As a person she‚Äôs the starlight of the office, always happy to have a quick chat, and emotionally very resilient. She‚Äôs honest and open and will not bring problems but preferably solutions. I can highly recommend Joyce to pull the strategy of any user-facing product and streamline the communication to development teams.

recommendations.name: Ramon Peek
recommendations.subtitle: Medior Azure Cloud Developer @ Fontys Hogeschool
recommendations.description:
If I have to describe Ramon in two words it would be smart and reliable. He is always quick with a helping hand, the first to react when bugs arise, and will come up with pragmatic solutions to quickly mitigate or resolve the issue. No lengthy argument as to why it is actually the user‚Äôs fault but an immediate solution and a plan to properly resolve this and future problems in the next release. He is an excellent software engineer in both backend and frontend development and has a keen eye for cloud technologies and setting up such infrastructure. 
Just as important as his engineering skills is his excellence as a colleague. Always kind, cheerful, and honest. I highly recommend Ramon as a solid and reliable full-stack developer who will strengthen any team he joins.

recommendations.description: Marcus joined our AI for Turtles Challenge and was one of the core contributors making the Challenge a great success! His knowledge of AI was instrumental both for the practical implementation but also his theoretical knowledge of metrics proved very valuable. His optimism and tendency to pick up responsibilities that are not accounted for made him a joy to work with. Last but not least his implementation of the LightGlue algorithm in the end proved to be the best performing algorithm!

recommendations.description: Hamzah showed great skills and took immediate responsibility during the AI for Turtles project. It was not only impressive how quickly he got a very high-performance segmentation model working on the provided data, he also immediately started working on it determining his own next steps, and communicating about his progress without extensive guidance. This does not only show his understanding of the field but also his ability to break down complex assignments and take responsibility.

While that might have been his formal role he picked up any task that he felt was lacking both technical and managerial ranging from product owner to platform architect. He proved he could do any of these tasks with quality and within time limit managing a vast array of difficult stakeholders in the process. I've got to know Willem as a very capable engineer with which I can discuss many technical topics as well as a thorough project manager who keeps control and oversight.

headline: CTO Italy - Wonderful
about:
I've been working in AI since before it became mainstream, driven by a childhood dream of creating inventions that could improve millions of lives. This led me to co-found Horus Technology in 2014, an AI company dedicated to enhancing the lives of nearly 300 million people who are blind or visually impaired. After successfully developing and scaling the technology, I led the company to a successful exit in 2019.

Following Horus, I led product development at Caricami (https://www.caricami.it). Currently, I serve as CTO at a Los Angeles-based startup studio operating in stealth mode, where I've helped launch over 20 ventures spanning SaaS, AI, and B2B/B2C products in a fully remote environment. I also provide consulting CTO and Mobile Development services to select companies.

I hold a MSc in Advanced Robotics and a BSc in Biomedical Engineering, with research experience at prestigious institutions including EPFL, IIT (Italy), and Ecole Centrale de Nantes. I'm also a proud alumnus of ISICT, the excellence school at the University of Genova, where I complemented my technical expertise with studies in management, economics, and law.

experiences.title: CTO
experiences.jobDescription:
Leading technical strategy and product development for a startup studio that launched 20+ digital products since 2023. Key responsibilities include:

Architecting B2B SaaS platforms and B2C applications across gaming, social networking, automotive, and AI sectors
Implementing autonomous AI systems and advanced technology solutions across our product portfolio

Building and engineers while maintaining hands-on involvement in core development

Establishing technical infrastructure and processes enabling rapid product iteration and market validation

experiences.title: Visiting Research Student
experiences.jobDescription: My research work at EPFL was related to the study of perception and obstacle avoidance strategies in insects, in particular bumblebees. I designed a 3D virtual environment, a virtual model of a bumblebee and used them to replay sequences of bumblebee avoiding obstacles in the real world. I then analysed the correlation between the movements and the simulated visual percepetion in order to identify which visual cues would be best to measure in a small flying robot as well as optimal sensor placement.

experiences.title: Visiting Research Student
experiences.jobDescription: I was part of a team working on the development of a 3D hopping robot. The robot only had two actuators with 8 degrees of freedom and is the first of its kind. My tasks included the design and optimization of transmission, mechanical parts, control strategy as well as battery and actuators dimensioning.

publications.title: Bio-inspired Active Vision for Obstacle Avoidance
publications.source: Proceedings of the 9th International Conference on Computer Graphics Theory and Applications, SciTePress
publications.summary: Reliable distance estimation of objects in a visual scene is essential for any artificial vision system designed to serve as the main sensing unit on robotic platforms. This paper describes a vision-centric framework for a mobile robot which makes use of bio-inspired techniques to solve visual tasks, in particular to estimate disparity. Such framework features robustness to noise, high speed in data processing, good performance in 3D reconstruction, the possibility to orientate the cameras independently and it requires no explicit estimation of the extrinsic parameters of the cameras. These features permit navigation with obstacle avoidance allowing active exploration of the scene. Furthermore, the modular design allows the integration of new modules with more advanced functionalities.

headline: CTO, Global Delivery @ Wonderful
jobLocation: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
addressWithCountry: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District Israel
about:
I‚Äôm a founder-builder and hands-on guy who ships applied-AI systems that make a measurable impact. My sweet spot is owning the path from concept ‚Üí PoC ‚Üí production ‚Üí business value, aligning architecture, data, and delivery with what customers actually need.

I led the design and delivery of AI platforms for supply-chain optimization - probabilistic demand forecasting, inventory optimization, and risk-aware planning - and for the ISP world, built on robust data pipelines and scalable infrastructure.
I‚Äôm pragmatic about models, strict about data quality and observability, and relentless about closing the loop between model outputs and business outcomes.

If you need to move faster from idea to impact - or level up an existing AI initiative - I bring leadership, architecture, and sleeves-rolled-up implementation.

experiences.title: CTO, Global Delivery
experiences.jobLocation: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel

experiences.title: CTO & Co-Founder
experiences.jobDescription:
Enterprise AI Platform for Supply Chain Intelligence

Built an applied-ML platform for manufacturers (forecasting, inventory optimization, risk-aware planning). Led product & engineering from zero to production deployments with customers:

(1) Turned messy demand/supply realities into probabilistic forecasting and risk-aware planning workflows teams could actually use in day-to-day operations.
(2) Drove PoC ‚Üí production programs with manufacturers: onboarding data, validation, success metrics, and value tracking.
(3) Established an AWS/Python stack with clean ingest, evaluation harnesses, monitoring/observability, and cost controls.
(4) Hired and coached a high-leverage team; set delivery discipline (code reviews, testing, incident playbooks).
(5) Partnered with business leaders on KPIs (service levels, stockouts, working capital), closing the loop from model to financial impact.

Architecture / Stack: Python, AWS, workflow orchestration, feature/data stores, evaluation & monitoring, agentic patterns where they help.

Public writing as CTO: authored Hexight blog pieces on agentic planning and uncertainty.

experiences.title: AI Acceleration Team Leader
experiences.jobDescription:
Led the AI Acceleration team to design and ship a PyTorch-based optimization layer inside GM‚Äôs proprietary training platform - turning research ideas into a production-grade capability used across the AV stack:

(1) Built a plug-in architecture that lets models tap 3rd-party acceleration libraries without refactoring research code.
(2) Shipped production support for Quantized Training, Pruning, and Knowledge Distillation, selectable per model/training run.
(3) >10√ó faster GPU training for key AV models, compressing experiment cycles and materially reducing compute cost.

Stack: PyTorch, Python, GPU acceleration, 3rd-party model optimization libraries; production integration with GM‚Äôs internal training infrastructure.

experiences.title: Lead Deep Learning Engineer
experiences.jobDescription:
Lead contributor for a TensorFlow-based neural-network optimization tool targeting Samsung‚Äôs dedicated AI hardware - turning research techniques into production acceleration across classification, detection, and ISP models:

(1) Built a modular optimization layer over TensorFlow to integrate with Samsung‚Äôs proprietary toolchain and hardware targets.
(2) Drove Quantization-aware Training (QAT), Pruning, and Knowledge Distillation from lab to production workflows.
(3) Reduced memory, power, and latency while preserving accuracy; delivered state-of-the-art results on internal IPs and benchmark suites.
(4) Implemented custom TensorFlow CUDA kernels for low-bitwidth training, improving training throughput by ‚âà50√ó on internal infrastructure.
(5) Standardized validation (accuracy/robustness vs. FP32 baselines) and rollout practices; authored docs and recipes for broad adoption.

Stack: TensorFlow, Python, CUDA/C++, low-bit QAT, pruning, distillation; dedicated/embedded AI accelerators.

experiences.title: Senior Data Scientist
experiences.jobDescription:
Computer-vision R&D for flagship foreground/background separation with a focus on precise border delineation and on-device delivery:

(1) Boosted model boundary precision by designing a training-aware loss function tailored to border errors.
(2) Partnered with Product and QA to sharpen problem framing, data quality, and evaluation criteria.
(3) Built cross-platform simulations (Windows & Linux) to verify performance and ensure bit-match with the embedded implementation.
(4) Prepared models for deployment under device constraints (profiling, compression, reliability checks).

Stack: Python, TensorFlow, CV modeling, custom loss design, evaluation/bit-match workflows, embedded constraints.

experiences.title: VP of Research & Co-Founder
experiences.jobDescription:
Privacy-Focused Decentralized Identity Platform

Co-founded and owned research + MVP delivery - taking the product from whiteboard ‚Üí MVP ‚Üí investor demos/pilots and shaping the product/technology roadmap from early customer needs:

(1) Sole designer/developer of the MVP‚Äôs core algorithmic + software stack for face liveness detection and authentication.
(2) Implemented a decentralized deep-learning platform for liveness & auth to avoid single points of failure and improve user privacy.
(3) Documented research/IP; co-inventor on a later-granted U.S. patent covering decentralized biometric identification & authentication.

Stack: Python, deep learning for facial biometrics (liveness, matching), computer vision, evaluation/benchmarking, distributed system design.

experiences.title: Senior System Analyst
experiences.jobDescription:
Led R&D of sensor-driven autonomous decision-making with partnering IDF intelligence tech units; owned simulation, evaluation, and rollout:

(1) Built MATLAB simulation & test harnesses to assess performance and optimize system parameters.
(2) Reverse-engineered complex C/C++ systems to map internals, improve reliability, and de-risk integrations.
(3) Drove model tuning and validation to meet operational KPIs.

Stack/Methods: MATLAB, C/C++, statistical modeling, sensor fusion, optimization, systems analysis.

experiences.title: Senior Algorithms & Embedded Systems Engineer
experiences.jobDescription:
Directed a multidisciplinary defense project with major industry partners; owned the full lifecycle requirements ‚Üí design ‚Üí verification:

(1) Designed embedded boards, digital peripherals, and power chains under strict SWaP constraints.
(2) Ran vendor/partner coordination, lab bring-up, and validation to schedule and quality targets.
(3) Established test plans and documentation for long-term maintainability.

Stack/Methods: Embedded systems, PCB design & bring-up, digital interfaces, power electronics, verification/validation.

experiences.title: Algorithms Engineer
experiences.jobDescription:
Algorithm R&D for communications & signal processing with a focus on autonomous decision workflows; built tools for analysis and ops alignment:

(1) Developed and tuned algorithms to improve detection, classification, and decision latency/accuracy.
(2) Created MATLAB simulations for sensitivity studies and parameter optimization.
(3) Translated operational needs into clear engineering specs and acceptance criteria.

Stack/Methods: MATLAB, signal processing, statistical modeling, optimization, performance evaluation.

experiences.title: Research Assistant
experiences.jobDescription:
Student research in signal processing & computational microscopy, focused on turning raw optical measurements into higher-fidelity images for analysis:

(1) Designed and implemented phase-reconstruction algorithms for optical diffraction imaging (phase retrieval from intensity-only data).
(2) Built simulation + analysis workflows to validate methods on synthetic and bench data, improving reconstruction stability and accuracy.
(3) Collaborated with experimental physicists to encode real-world constraints (noise, optics, sampling) into the algorithmic model.
(4) Delivered reproducible code and documentation used in ongoing lab experiments and demos.

Methods/Stack: Signal processing, inverse problems, Fourier optics, phase retrieval, computational imaging.

publications.title: A novel ischemia reperfusion injury hereditary tissue model for pressure ulcers progression
publications.summary: Ischemia reperfusion injury (IRI) involvement in pressure ulcers (PU) progression via a surge of oxidative stress and inflammatory responses is well documented. IRI strongly depends on the mechanical loading history. We present a generalized IRI model considering external loading, dynamic tissue healing capacity, accumulating mechanical and reperfusion-mediated damages and competing repair processes of saturating nature. Reperfusion depends on strain and strain rate to enhance loading history sensitivity. Tissue-specific ulceration susceptibility is assumed dependent on variable accumulated damage. We study damage evolution under cyclic loading having several strain expulsion profiles and demonstrate load relief history has critical impact on PU progression. Abrupt load removal generally follows existing models representing extreme repair/damage. We show (first time in silico) that under certain conditions (previously experimentally identified), IRI becomes repairing rather than damaging. In particular, we recapitulate the preconditioning and postconditioning IRI hallmarks. Finally, it is customary among physicians and nurses to promptly alleviate mechanical load applied to patients lying in bed for extended periods and in risk of developing PUs. We demonstrate this practice can be harmful. If load removal is performed early while reperfusion is still beneficial, then this conduct is suitable. However, if critical tissue damage has been crossed, then abrupt expulsion can constitute the worst-case scenario for patient outcome. If no preliminary patient documentation is available, we recommend gradual load removal since risks of accelerated damage eventually leading to ulceration supersede the improved repair potential benefit.

publications.title: Moving Shadow Detection by non-linear Tone-Mapping
publications.source: 19th International Conference on Systems, Signals and Image Processing (IWSSIP)
publications.summary: Shadow detection is a well-known problem in image and video processing. Detecting moving shadows is useful in numerous applications such as object detection and tracking. Most works in this area are not suitable for shadow detection using a low-cost outdoor surveillance camera. In this work we suggest a fast shadow detection approach for video surveillance, by comparing each video frame to a continuously updated background image. We differentiate shadow areas from foreground areas by assuming the shadow pixels are associated with background pixels through a nonlinear tone mapping. This assumption is general and applies to various systems and scene conditions. A distance measure between patch images that account for nonlinear tone mapping is calculated by adapting a recently suggested approach for pattern matching termed Matching by Tone Mapping (MTM). We show that the proposed technique is computationally efficient and outperforms state-of-the-art shadow detection techniques in typical surveillance scenarios.

publications.title: Sparsity based single-shot sub-wavelength coherent diffractive imaging
publications.summary: Coherent Diffractive Imaging (CDI) is an algorithmic imaging technique where intricate features are reconstructed from measurements of the freely diffracting intensity pattern. An important goal of such lensless imaging methods is to study the structure of molecules that cannot be crystallized. Ideally, one would want to perform CDI at the highest achievable spatial resolution and in a single-shot measurement such that it could be applied to imaging of ultrafast events. However, the resolution of current CDI techniques is limited by the diffraction limit, hence they cannot resolve features smaller than one half the wavelength of the illuminating light. Here, we present sparsity-based single-shot subwavelength resolution CDI: algorithmic reconstruction of subwavelength features from far-field intensity patterns, at a resolution several times better than the diffraction limit. This work paves the way for subwavelength CDI at ultrafast rates, and it can considerably improve the CDI resolution with X-ray free-electron lasers and high harmonics.

publications.title: Far-Field Microscopy of Sparse Subwavelength Objects
publications.summary: We present the experimental reconstruction of sub-wavelength features from the far-field of sparse optical objects. We show that it is sufficient to know that the object is sparse, and only that, and recover 100 nm features with the resolution of 30 nm, for an illuminating wavelength of \lambda=532 nm. Our technique works in real-time, requires no scanning, and can be implemented in all existing microscopes - optical and non-optical.
